content: Yes, words DO matter. “White folks, we don’t get lynched. We don’t have a clue what lynching is like, or what the spectre of its possibility would feel like in our lives, ever. We don’t have that history.” Keep studying history. It seems that there is quite a bit of it that you missed. Also from Wikipedia: “The Tuskegee Institute has recorded 3,446 blacks and 1,297 whites being lynched between 1882 and 1968.” You might also look into the Johnson County War, the San Francisco Vigilance Movement and the saga of John Heath of Tombstone, AZ. While I would agree that there were more blacks lynched than whites, the idea that “we don’t have that history” is just plain false.
